author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Chief Judicial Magistrate Court on Wednesday acquitted Tamizhaga Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam president, John Pandian and 11 others accused in Sempatti violence case in 2011, as the prosecution failed to prove the case beyond reasonable doubt.

On hearing the case, Chief Judicial Magistrate S. Jeganathan said that the prosecution failed to prove the case and freed all the accused including John Pandian.

Petrol bomb was hurled at a corporation bus proceeding to Theni from Dindigul at Ramanathapuram near Sempatti during violence after a police opened fire during Immanual Sekaran Guru Puja at Paramakudi in Ramanathapuram district in 2011.

Three persons including bus conductor Raju were injured in the petrol bomb attack.

The Sempatti police had registered a case.
title: John Pandian acquitted in 2011 violence case
